perturbation.original_text: Unless otherwise set forth in the applicable Facility Addendum with respect to a particular Product or Products, Customer shall pay all undisputed amounts due in the currency specified in the applicable Facility Addendum within sixty (60) calendar days from the date of the invoice. If Customer disputes all or any portion of an invoice, it shall be required to pay only the amount not in dispute, and in such event Customer shall notify Manufacturer of the amount and nature of the dispute. Payment by Customer of any amount reflected in any invoice shall not result in a waiver of any of Customer’s rights under this Agreement. If any payment required to be made under this Agreement is not made within twenty (20) days of the applicable date when such payment is due (the “Late Payment Date”), interest shall accrue on such past due amount from the Late Payment Date until the date payment is actually made at a quarterly rate equal to the lesser of (i) the Three-Month U.S. dollar LIBOR (Reuters Page LIBOR01) on the Late Payment Date (or the next Business Day if such Late Payment Date is not a Business Day), and (ii) the maximum rate permitted by applicable Law. Time for any payments hereunder shall be of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text: Unless otherwise set forth in the applicable Facility Addendum with respect to a particular Product or Products, Customer shall pay all undisputed amounts due in the currency specified in the applicable Facility Addendum within ninety (90) calendar days from the date of the invoice. If Customer disputes all or any portion of an invoice, it shall be required to pay only the amount not in dispute, and in such event Customer shall notify Manufacturer of the amount and nature of the dispute within 120 calendar days. Payment by Customer of any amount reflected in any invoice shall result in a waiver of all of Customer’s rights under this Agreement. If any payment required to be made under this Agreement is not made within one hundred and eighty (180) days of the applicable date when such payment is due (the “Late Payment Date”), no interest shall accrue on such past due amount from the Late Payment Date until the date payment is actually made. Time for any payments hereunder is not of the essence.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts typical prompt payment laws and general contract principles. Extending the payment term to 90 days without reasonable justification may violate certain state laws regarding payment terms for goods and services. Waiving all customer rights upon any payment is an unconscionable term. Removing interest on late payments and stating that time is not of the essence removes any incentive for prompt payment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by state, but generally violates prompt payment acts and fair contract principles.

perturbation.original_text: Within ten (10) Business Days of receipt of a Purchase Order, Manufacturer may reject such Purchase Order by written notice to Customer only on the basis that it is inconsistent with the terms of this Agreement, including a Purchase Order containing (i) a delivery schedule that is inconsistent with Section 2.4(d), (ii) a Product quantity that is inconsistent with Section 2.4(e)(ii), (iii) a Product quantity that is less than the Firm Order for the applicable period or (iv) subject to Section 2.4(c), a Product quantity that is more than one hundred ten percent (110%) of the Forecast for the applicable period. Manufacturer shall be deemed to have accepted Customer’s Purchase Order for Products in the event it either (a) indicates its acceptance of Customer’s Purchase Order in writing or (b) does not indicate its rejection of a Purchase Order within ten (10) Business Days of receipt pursuant to this Section 2.4(f).
perturbation.changed_text: Within one (1) Business Days of receipt of a Purchase Order, Manufacturer may reject such Purchase Order by written notice to Customer only on the basis that it is inconsistent with the terms of this Agreement, including a Purchase Order containing (i) a delivery schedule that is inconsistent with Section 2.4(d), (ii) a Product quantity that is inconsistent with Section 2.4(e)(ii), (iii) a Product quantity that is less than the Firm Order for the applicable period or (iv) subject to Section 2.4(c), a Product quantity that is more than one hundred ten percent (110%) of the Forecast for the applicable period. Manufacturer shall be deemed to have accepted Customer’s Purchase Order for Products in the event it either (a) indicates its acceptance of Customer’s Purchase Order in writing.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the rejection timeframe to 1 business day and removing the auto-acceptance clause creates an impossibly short review window. This contradicts contract law principles of reasonable opportunity to review and accept terms, potentially making the acceptance terms unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles, UCC Article 2.

perturbation.original_text: Customer may reject any Non-Complying Product or Product that is not delivered to Customer in accordance with this Agreement by providing written notice of such rejection to Manufacturer within seventy-five (75) days following Customer’s receipt of any Delivery of Product hereunder; provided, however, that Customer may, until the expiry date for a Product, provide notice of rejection of any Delivery of such Product having (i) latent defects, (ii) any defects that are not reasonably discoverable by Customer through standard inspection and testing of Products or (iii) defects caused by the breach by Manufacturer of any of its representations or warranties under this Agreement (collectively, “Latent Defects”); provided, further, that, and notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer shall notify Manufacturer within sixty (60) days after Customer first becomes aware of any such Latent Defect.
perturbation.changed_text: Customer may reject any Non-Complying Product or Product that is not delivered to Customer in accordance with this Agreement by providing verbal notice of such rejection to Manufacturer within ten (10) days following Customer’s receipt of any Delivery of Product hereunder; Customer cannot provide notice of rejection of any Delivery of such Product having (i) latent defects, (ii) any defects that are not reasonably discoverable by Customer through standard inspection and testing of Products or (iii) defects caused by the breach by Manufacturer of any of its representations or warranties under this Agreement (collectively, “Latent Defects”).
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the rejection period to 10 days and specifying verbal notice is insufficient. Eliminating the ability to reject for latent defects, or defects discoverable after a reasonable inspection time, conflicts with UCC implied warranty provisions and commercial reasonableness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: UCC implied warranty of merchantability, UCC right to reject non-conforming goods.
